text: Hesitant to come here because of the reviews, but I walked in and the cashier was super friendly and the horchata was amazing. Angie treated us like family. The enchiladas with the green sauce reminds me of California burritos. Good place
This place is on my way to work  I try they tacos rice & beans Is under new management A family business Was really good
I always love this place, Hot, fresh food. Always friendly. They get it done fast, at a great price. They're steak quesadillas and Nachos are the Bomb!!
Great place for quality Mexican food. Had the enchiladas. Service was quick and reliable.
It's not the same. I'm rather disappointed. The carne asada was decent but not overly tasty, the pastor bland. It's also over priced. Sorry, I'm not going back.

So I am a vegetarian and I have to say this place has hands down the most amazing veggie burrito in Chicago! It does not have any weird rice fillers in it. And the people who work here are so nice. It's also soooo cheap, how could you not buy it?

This is the closest spot to me that sells "authentic" Mexican food. However I think it's more Americanized. The food is good but not outstanding. They put mozzarella (not chihuahua) cheese, sour cream, lettuce and tomato on their tacos and burritos and it just makes it all taste a lot worse. If you like Americanized tacos and burritos then by all means this would be a great spot. I prefer to tell them to just keep it to cilantro and onion. The tamales are decent here too, they're not dry at all but at the same time they're pretty plain with no sauce. Customer service here is eh and they've been closed multiple times when they should have been open.  I just found out about El Presidente which is about two blocks north up Ashland and their tacos are already much more fresh. I'd rather go there.

This is a hole in the wall sort of place that may leave people questioning whether or not they want to try it but  give it a try!  The chicken fajita meal is so good! The chicken taste fresh and it comes with cooked bell peppers, rice and beans. All the food is seasoned well, cooked well and tasty.  The fajitas come with hot soft tortillas on the side.  I would not suggest this as a dine in place but definitely recommend for take out!

Ordered a jr. burrito dinner. The guy gives me a cup because the dinner comes with a drink but then I don't get the rice and beans. I'm told he only charged me for the burrito. Of course their receipts aren't itemized, but i knew a burrito and taco dinner didn't add up to $16 even with chicago tax. And if he only charged me for the burrito then he charged me for the drink (refils are 60 cents btw, wtf). I specifically ordered a dinner.  I give them 1 star for ripping me off alone. The food was bad, everything tasted off. The tomatoes tasted old and the beans had an odd taste. I see why every other mexican place nearby them has a higher rating.

The best place to get greasy goodness at all times of the day. The nachos are my personal favorite. I use to go here to get a good dinner with my roommate after some partying. It is very nice on a budget! Friendly staff, and fast service.

I've been coming to this Taco & Burrito house since 1996 and it is one of the best in the area. Not all "taco spots" are created equally. Come here and you'll understand what I mean. My favorites are the "Fajita Dinner" or the "Steak Nacho Supreme." They use real cheese, not fake cheese like TBK. Almost anything you buy is under $10 and I've never had a bad meal.  If you are looking for quantity and plan on buying a taco dinner, just order the fajita dinner. You'll get a huge plate of steak, lettuce, tomatoes, peppers, beans, rice and a separate container holding warm tortillas. You can make at least (6) tacos and get alot more food!  (Can you tell I'm fat?!) lol.  TIPS** This place is open very late and on Saturday nights you will have drunk yuppies and thugs. lol. Also, they do have a bathroom but you have to "know" about it. Just ask, you have to walk through the kitchen though.  Seating in the entire restaurant is weird. When it's busy people are in your personal space, a cold draft will also find it's way in and parking is horrible. I suggest parking on Bosworth NOT Fullerton unless you are just running in. DON'T EVEN THINK ABOUT PARKING AT THE BUILDING ACROSS THE STREET. They will tow you immediately.

Exceptional tacos and burritos, but the real treat is the southern hospitality feeling that you get from the staff when you walk through the door. Beautiful decor, feels like you are walking right into Mexico. The bathroom is in the back and it is quite a treat walking through the kitchen to get to. 10/10 would recommend. Might wanna be a little high

Wow this was the worst meal I have ever had. I mean I had nachos and they were bitter and had no crunch.  Which means they were cooked in old oil and flat out stale.  Next issue, pretty sure that was 7/11 nacho cheese "sauce". I mean I knew it wasn't going to be a flavor experience but...wow. Just wow.

We stopped by here last Friday night. The place looked clean the prices were good and we were hungry. Ordered some basic food that looked wonderful. Unfortunately, two minutes after we sat down to eat, an employee blasted the music so loud it was pure torture. WGCI louder than you can imagine. Rap hip hop and commercials not stop. I had to hold my hands over my ears and try to eat at the same time. I could not believe this. It was too loud to even go up and say something to the guy. I don't know what was the deal but it was almost as if they were trying to drive the customers out. Well, in our case it worked. We were out the door as fast as we could shovel in the food and run. Needless to say, we didn't really have a chance to enjoy or even taste the food. A total waste and very anxiety inducing. To quote an old Fleetwood Mac song, I'm never going back again.

I was very excited to check this place out, since I live across the street and love Mexican food. I was sadly disappointed because the food was bland, there was no flavor at all. I had the chicken tacos, and a side of guacamole. I won't be back, which is sad since it's so close to our place.

This little place is great if you want cheap Mexican food. It looks a bit intimidating at first but their prices can't be beaten. But keep in mind that you're spending less than 5 bucks for food - don't expect amazing quality, but at least you'll be filled right up. I had the junior chicken burrito from here and personally thought it was a pretty average burrito, so yeah, if I were in the area and hungry and didn't want to spend any money then this is the place I would hit up.

Since getting a new job over in this area I have eaten here a few times. There are not many lunch spots to select from, but if you are in the area and have a craving for steak tacos or tamales this is the place to come. They are quick, in expensive, and friendly.
Always a good late night option. Staff is friendly even when they are swamped. The quesadillas and nachos supreme are the way to go.
Quick consistent  service. Open late which is always a plus. Staff knows my order when I walk in. Get the steak nachos or crispy quesadillas.

I go way back with this place, used to go here alllll the time when I lived in LP. Went again last night for the first time in long time. Love it still, even though basically I've been drunk every time I go there.  Burrito special is the way to go, or any special. You get two sides, choice between fries, beans, salad, fries, QUESADILLA, etc. I love the chorizo burrito, so so good.  I want to go here when I'm not drunk, then maybe I'll give it another star. But still, big fan.
A hidden gem. Pico de Gallo is super fresh and spicy and their horchata is spot on. A great plus that it's open late, especially for us industry folk.

This is how my boyfriend explained this place to me..."Uh, yeah. Two of my friends were mugged walking home from there. But it's 11pm on a Sunday, so let's go". So you know what we did? We went.  I drove to be safer. Only to park right in front of the place they were mugged. It's cool though. We didn't get mugged. Instead we ended up with two glorious burritos.  And by glorious burritos, I mean, I got the vegetarian burrito that was basically mush and he got the steak fajita burrito that he claimed was lava hot for up to 20 minutes after receiving it. He wasn't lying. And he said it happens everytime and it's only the steak fajita burrito. I don't know, I don't eat meat, so I'll take his word on it.  Anyways...the place itself is what you would expect a Mexican place that is open until 1am on a Sunday to be like. Yellow and greasy. And if I was drunk I'd be in love. But instead I was simply hungover and hungry.  Would I go back? My burrito was $2.70, so Uhhh, yeah.

3.5 stars Wanted a really quick bite near our massage place, and this was down the street. The interior decor looks kind of sketchy like you'd probably get sick from eating here. The tables with little squares that look like bathroom tiles don't help.  But the food was pretty good! No doubt it would make pretty good drunk food, but even during actual meal times, it would be a really good place to eat.  Best of all, its sooo cheap. The junior burritos are under $5 and are very decently sized, more than enough to fill me up.  Get beef tongue! It was so much more tender than I expected and super flavorful.

This place just sucks. Like all the other lincoln park taquerias.  How do u fuq up al pastor?? Well this place did. Zero atmosphere. So whitewashed. My friend threw up afterwards. So many better taquerias in chicago it isn't even funny. And it looks like it should be good 2 lol

Came in here one night with a friend after moving in and seeing this place on my way. Both of us left full and very happy! I grabbed myself a chicken quesadilla while my friend grabbed a taco and horchata with it. The quesadilla was out of this world--it was absolutely delicious full of fresh toppings and a good portion! I haven't tried the horchata but my friend says it's one of the best she's had! The place is quite tiny and very hidden, but it doesn't get too crowded which is good. The food was prepared very quickly and service was great! Plus the food is very affordable which is great for us college kids with crippling meal plans. I have gone two times already and I plan on coming back more! (Whenever the weather warms up!)
Despite having zero atmosphere, their food is surprisingly good, and the servings are big for the money. I definitely recommend it.
Stopped by for a lunch-time burrito this afternoon.  It was a good veggie burrito. If I was in the area and wanted a quick lunch, I'd stop by again.
Worst burritos ever. I took one bite of my burrito and it tasted cardboard and dust from the attic. I'm exaggerating but it's pretty close to it. Lets see how I feel in the morning.

If it's late at night and you're desperate for some hot food to cram into your maw, then this place will do fine.  The food is below average, but is ready quick and hasn't given me food poisoning to date.

I've eaten here many times, and the food has been pretty average. The one star is for overcharging me, and then lying to my face about the price.  On top of that I get home, and they didn't even give me everything I asked for, so I was double-ripped off.  I am venting here because nobody seems to be in charge there, so there is nobody to complain to.  I put up with the bad employee attitude because the prices are so low, but stealing from me, especially when I always leave a good tip, is just offensive. Never again.

I was actually looking for a Chinese restaurant that I'd eaten at before that was located within a few doors of this place so when I saw it was no longer in business I decided to check out this place. Upon entering I was greeted by a nice young man who was immediately ready to take my order.  The really nice part is that when I indicated I needed some time to check out the menu he did not seem the least bit peturbed that he'd have to wait for me to make up my mind.  I love good old fashioned customer service!  Another thing I appreciated was he asked me if I wanted hot sauce on it.  I'm the type that can't handle any heat in my food so I appreciated that he asked rather than just dumping it in the food. I got a Jr. burrito meal and I'm glad I only got the Jr. size and not the large one.  The burrito was very large and even though I was very hungry I was stuffed by the time I finished eating it all.  I don't know how big the large ones are but I am sure if they're much bigger than the Jr. size ones that they would have to be too much for 99% of the people to eat in one sitting.  The burrito had very good flavor and I will definitely stop in again if I'm in the area. As far as the sides go they really impressed me.  The burrito itself was very good but on this meal the sides were the stars.  The Spanish rice was just like my Mom used to make and had a nice tomato taste in it.  Normally I'm not a fan of refried beans, but I ended up eating all of my beans.  Instead of the normal bland mush that so many places serve the refried beans here had a nice flavor to them.  I had trouble identifying the extra flavor but I suspect it may have been a bit of a bacon flavor. I have no doubt that I'll be returning here if I find myself in the area and looking for a good meal.

This place has great quick Mexican fare. I love the way they finish the tortillas for the burritos with that perfect crispness and also I really am fond with their style of salsa which has a perfect consistency like a sauce more than a pico de gallo like a lot if other places.
My carne asada burrito was almost inedibly salty. Boo. I'm not squeamish about salt but this was kinda rough.

Came for a quick lunch. It was not my idea to come here.  The food was nothing special, and very greasy.  The portions were huge though.  Perfect for college students on a budget.  So, I guess they are in the right place for that.  I will most likely not go back.  I can't even believe I went in the first place.

My boyfriend and I had eaten here quite a few times since it's right around the corner from me. However, he had a terrible case of food poisoning from this place that left him out of commission for quite a few days. This place is no frills and sometimes that's a good thing but I would rather take my business to Allende where I know everything is quality and I won't be sick for days.
It's a good choice when you need cheap and greasy to take the edge off of the alcohol over indulgence. Don't expect service with a smile. Or good food.

I carried out - taco dinner with the steak.  The service is really good, and the food was fine, but very bland.  The tacos were still very good, rice and beans okay - again, just needs a little more flavor to differentiate this taco place from any other.

YUM!!!  I've only gone sober and I can say that yes, even sober, the food is AMAZING! The cheese and bean burrito was awesome! I LOVE the way they cook the tortilla so it's nice and crisp. The only issue I had was that the tomatos in the burrito were super runny but it hardly mattered. The guys working there are super nice. Also, their bathrooms (when I went in the middle of a Saturday afternoon) were spotless!

THE best Mexican restaurant in the DePaul area!!   Small area for dining, but who cares?  They keep the place REALLY clean ( I know since I've been in there just before they start getting ready to close at 3am--Thurs, and hate to step on there freshly cleaned floor or touch their counter-tops).  Absolutely THE BEST burrito around, and the prices are very reasonable.  It may not look like much, but don't knock it 'till you've actually tried it.

I have a secret fear that TB house has a security camera and that one day the owners will post the footage of boozy debauchery and drunk eating on youtube. TB house is open late and satisfies a "fifth meal" need. It officially counts as the last '"poor decision" of an evening of poor decisions. I wish I could write an honest review of the food, decor, etc, but like most patrons of TB house I am incapable of remembering all that much about it.  That being said, I do know the burritos are fantastic, and the rice & beans side is very tasty. Unfortunately, I got the steak fajitas last night. The meat was chewy and terrible. I would avoid this option. Stick to the burrito or the quesadilla. I also hate their credit card policy about $15 minimum, so bring cash. I don't think I will ever eat Taco Burrito house before 12AM, but its yummy late night.
Not bad for a late-night spot. The chicken was well-seasoned and tender. Horchata was pretty good. Salsa was super thin. Okay flavor, but not much of it. The end.

Was never given the opportunity to eat here.  Just wanted to post as I want buyers to be aware of possible fraud.  Not blaming the actual restaurant, but somehow they are connected with a website that I don't believe is theirs  tbhchicago.com  and additionally this website may be linked to a fraud 3rd party delivery service "ohyeahdelivery.com"   Buyer beware.  I would recommend contacting local authorities if you run into any trouble with either websites.  Be careful and think before answering any questions on line to create a profile for delivery.
These guys are great.  Wasted they make my favorite Mexican

I just had a tostada from here and unfortunately it came nothing close. it was more like a sea of grease drowning a tortilla it was so soggy. Coming from a hispanic background  i was insulted, the only reason it must still be open is that its clientel is far from being latin the students from depaul should watch out, its wasnt clean and the service was lousy.   Try Zaca Tacos on 51st and Pulaski. yelp.com/biz/zacatacos-c…

The following is a true story: I was in the neighborhood  picking up a friend for Halloween weekend when I happened to park in front of TBH. Turned out my friend lived in the apartment behind this place. It was around 6pm and I was starving.  I knew I had to eat something before hittin' the town so I decide to eat here since I'm already here. Walking inside I could see a three-man team behind the counter waiting for me. The place seemed somewhat empty. I feared not. Usually my go-to choice for Mexican food is a steak burrito or a couple lengua tacos (yeah, I'm all about the tongue). Lo and behold, the menu listed BEEF TONGUE BURRITO as an option. Up until now I had never ordered a lengua burrito...but that's because I've never seen it as an option.  I was so excited. I placed my order at the front counter and made sure to tell them to ADD CILANTRO (pro-tip: it's not normally included). Within two minutes they handed me a brown bag (I ordered to-go) and I ran back to my friend's place to eat it. I open the bag 'n took a couple bites...I was in BURRITO HEAVEN. Never before had I enjoyed a burrito this much...and I was sober. One of my favorite things about this burrito is that it doesn't come with rice. Who needs rice? More room for meat! Sour cream was standard...as if they knew. Everything in this burrito melded together perfectly. They threw in a tiny container of red salsa & green salsa.  Both were good. My buddy and I cabbed it around town to attend a few Halloween parties.Three parties, eight hours, and a couple drinks later I came back to pick up my car...and was hungry.  Can you guess what I was thinking? HELL YES...TWICE.  Oh yes I did! (It was technically a different day, right?) This time there was a line going out the door! I didn't care. The burrito team behind the counter was taking care of business...crankin' them out.  Before I knew it I was sitting down staring at another beef tongue burrito.  This time I had squeeze bottles of hot sauce 'n salsa verde.  I ordered an horchata to wash it down. My plate looked clean. No shame here.  Fast. Tasty. Cheap. Great portions. Good Horchatas. Minus two stars for the grease. Add one star because the grease was tasty! I don't always eat beef tongue burritos, but when I do...I eat them at TBH...two at a time.

Wow. I'm surprised why this place hasn't closed down. I should've listened to my roommates' advice on their greasy food. Don't worry - as soon as I walked in my nose was immediately clogged with grease. So much, that I couldn't even focus on their menu. I got their horchata (rice water) and EVEN THAT was nasty. It smelled like grease and was suuuper sweetened. It tasted just like diluted sweetened condensed milk. No kidding.  These guys make Mexican culture look bad. You guys should be ashamed of yourself. Because Mexican food is not greasy. It's healthy.

A nice little place for a quick inexpensive meal... Steak taco and steak burrito are very good. The sides for me are always rice & beans (re-fried). I usually get a glass of horchata with dinner.  Sometimes the chef can be a little heavy with the salt but over-all a nice little place.... Just ordered the chicken burrito for the 1st time, parts were a little dry and a little salty.  portion was big (too big) and need I to try the chicken in their taco...

I have definitely eaten a better burrito.  They put way too much beans and sour cream on their burritos.  The meat was also relatively flavorless.  I tried a chicken burrito, and my fiance had a steak burrito.

My boyfriend and I visited Chicago recently, and a friend gave us a very nice tour of downtown and the Lincoln Park area before taking us here for lunch. I've gotten kind of picky with my Mexican food over the years (cuz I've eaten too much of the good stuff to go back to mediocre), and the place definitely did the trick.  I got the beef tongue torta, my boyfriend got the junior burrito (because he's too much of a wuss for the bigger burrito, apparently) and our friend got tacos. We were all quite pleased with the flavors. We got chips and guac to start with as well, and I don't know if it was because we were super hungry or what, but that stuff didn't last long at all.  The prices were nice, the portions were big, and the service was friendly. You can't go wrong with that.

The food here sucked. I ordered two carne asada tacos and a carne asada burrito which are usually standard safe items at any mexican place. The quality of meat was very bad--the tacos were one tiny notch above El Ranchito, which is not saying much at all. The burrito was slightly better but only because the tortilla had this simultaneous chewy crispy texture (kind of like it was grilled). However my review might be biased because when I go to small-run down taco joints, I expect the tacos to be small and have strictly carne asada, cilantro, and onions. Not all that sour cream, american cheese blend, lettuce, and tomato shtuff. Also what makes good legit mexican food is the HOT SAUCE (I see you King Taco in LA) and this place had overly fire-roasted hot sauce and a flavorless, mild green hot sauce.

I love Taco Burrito House, and I'm not even a real fan of this type of food, but they get it right.  Their tortilla chips are really good, too, even the next day.  One of the only taco places in Chicago I like.

had the taco dinner for lunch. $4.75, two tacos, rice and beans...not bad, yet minimum for credit card is $8....tacos are decent, tortillas to soft so they break apart fast......rice and beanrs ok....my meal was under $10 with the extra tacos that is a bit pricey $2.25 and small.
Doesn't matter if you're drunk, high or neither TBH is really good Mexican food.  Also they have a painting of some chick with a huge rack on the wall!   Bonus feature in my book.  God Bless TBH!!!

This place really is as good as it gets for a taco stand. I've seen hundreds of places like these on every block in every corner of the city but I haven't been to one as good. Its cheap and consistent for the genre. Surprisingly I never went here drunk, but I'm confident if I did it would have made the morning after THAT much better.

I am never disappointed when I come here!!! The service is awesome super fast no matter what!!! I love the veggie and the steak tacos. Most importantly I love their Horchata! I don't care where I am in the city if I have a hankering for a taco I am going to the T & B for sure!!!

The people at this place are great! I came in with a stroller and they opened the doors for me. If you have kids, you know how difficult it can be to get a stroller through doors wspecially with the weird entrances in Chicago. I got a steak taco as well as a pork taco and they were great! When the guys in the restaurant saw that I was leaving, they stopped what they were doing to open the doors for me again. Never have I been to a place where so many people are so helpful!

My favorite taco place in Chicago.  The service is super fast, even on a busy weekend night/'way early morning.  This place is popular with the after bar crowd, like me. I am a huge fan of their veggie burrito. For some reason, I am thrilled with the lettuce they use, I"m not kidding.   They are super nice, never lose their cool with all the drunk frat boys, and are always super willing to make substitutions to the orders. Taco Burrito House, you have my vote!

This place seems to get a lot of love on Yelp.  Yes, it's great they serve so late.  And yes, the prices are low.  And yes, the bathrooms are clean. But if you're not drunk or high, I don't know how you could really enjoy the food.  Everything we ordered was bland and tasteless, even after drowning the food in hot sauce.
Exactly what you need if it's late and you're hungry: great food and fast service.   Bonus: you can get a cheese quesadilla as a side!  Life's great discoveries.

I love this place. My buddies live across the street so I go lot. Great service, super friendly staff. Little flirty with the girls, but I see that in lots of places. Great food. I have tried just about everything. Wish the tongue was cooked a little more traditionally.  Overall, top 5 Mexican joints (location, price, food quality, service)  They even gave my friend and I our meals on the house last night because the dudes like us. Can't top a free torta meal when drunk!

This place is heaven on earth.  If you don't get it - then go to Taco Bell and don't bother these masters of the burrito. First of all - the service is top shelf - better than just about any other late night joint that has to appease drunken trixies from Lincoln Park who had one too many Bud Lights.  Most people would be hurling bean dip across the counter - but these guys keep it cool. The food is fresh and perfectly prepared. While I am more a taco guy than a burrito guy - this TBH is one place I will never be dissatisfied no matter what I order.  In addition to being picture perfect - my lengua burrito was a symphony of savory soul. Everything was balanced and delicious.  Even their horchata is better than everyone else. If you want the best taco or burrito - go to Taco Burrito House on Fullerton and Ashland and be prepared to be blown out of the agua!
Well I really like their food, but they  need to worry also about  keeping clean the area including  the restrooms
Prices are cheap and food is good! I'd definitely come back anytime, even sober :)

What happened to you Burrito House? You once were my favorite taco/burrito joint. You now officially suck! Crappy, oversalted steak burrito and tacos. The meat was grisly and to add insult to injury they got my order incorrect and overcharged me.

If you are heading home from the bar, this place is cheap, and will taste like the best crappy taco joint food you have ever eaten. Add two stars. If you're sober, it is still cheap, and it just tastes like crappy food. The shells are sometimes hard in places (the soft shells...), and the beef is partially tough, chewy, and uneven. Subtract two stars.

These guys are burrito making machines. Even when its 2am and the place is jammed with drunks, they turn out those cheap burritos fast.  This place makes the best cheese quesadillas. Seriously, I don't know why they are so damn tasty but they are. You can get one as a side when you order a meal.  I love tortas, and their steak torta is a classic. It is also one of the cheapest items on the menu- you can get a torta meal with a drink and 2 sides for under 6 bucks. If I'm not feeling like a torta, I always get the chicken flautas. Soooo good. I once took a group of drunk out of town co-workers here and they loved it- I was the late night hero.

Taco & Burrito House is cheap, fast and tasty - all the things a burrito joint should be.  Do they have the best tacos and burritos I've ever had?  No, but they're still pretty darn good.  I had some ground beef tacos, which were flavorful and not super greasy, and my friend had a steak burrito.  I tend to stay away from steak meals in burrito places, as the meat can sometimes be pretty tough, but that was definitely the case here (I might have had a bite or two of my friend's burrito...).  Definitely a good spot to get tacos in the future.

I'm semi vegetarian.  What does that MEAN exactly?  I like to order vegetarian platters from time to time.  I don't always need to slaughter an animal so I can eat.  I love bratwurst.  Alright, let's move on.   I used to live around the corner from this place.  I'd heard some rave reviews, and I thought, hey, "Why not meander down the street for a burrito?"  I did.  I was not impressed.  It lacked the certain magic that a burrito should have.  I'm not sure how to describe it, but I'm sure you KNOW what I'm talking about.   I walked away full, food in mouth transplant successful.   Own up time:  In a rush?  Need orchata?  Fine.  But don't make this a special trip.

Cheap, fast, and great food -- the perfect combination.  Their king-size beef tongue burrito is awesome, even when sober.  Slightly crispy tortillas packed with chopped-up meat, no rice filler.  The king-size is a little smaller than La Pasadita's super burrito, but it's a couple bucks cheaper too.   I wouldn't say that the burritos are greasy, but they're definitely a little on the juicy/buttery side.  I have to admit, the bottom fell out once, which is like the cardinal sin of burritos.  Not good for eating while driving unless you don't mind looking like you pissed your pants.  No frills, but great food-per-dollar value.

The Staff: These guys are machines. Rain, snow, or fight, these guys just don't stop making burritos. This is a totally true story. One late night after having a few beers, Z and I decided to grab a couple of burritos at The House. We placed our orders and I made my way to the bathroom. While I was away at the bathroom, all hell had broken loose. In one corner of the restaurant were two dudes wrestling each other to the ground. In another corner was some dude yelling at another dude who was shielding his girlfriend. In the main area was a very wet floor covered by several broken chairs, a flipped table and four dudes who were trading punches with each other. It was mass chaos. I thought about my safety briefly, but found myself more concerned with my burrito. Afterall, it was 4am and nothing beats a good burrito after an evening's booze fest. So my attention turned towards the kitchen. Even though a major fight was taking place behind them, the cooks worked fervently on the backlogged burrito orders. Because of the staff's solid work ethic and dedication, there was no delay in me getting fed. Eventually the fight carried to the outdoors and the CPD showed up. The cops did their job in cleaning up the riff raff, while Miguel, the head janitor at the Burrito House did his job in cleaning up the floor so the guests could get back to what mattered most; burrito eatin'. The Food: Greasy and not so good. Burrito House presents a slightly different burrito than most typical Chicago style burrito joints. I have had the chicken burrito here several times. The burrito is primarily meat based. (In other words there are not a lot of vegetables.) The meat is cube cut and tastes like it's been fried in a heavy garlic oil. The garlic really penetrates the meat and its like a garlic explosion in your mouth with each bite. And about that oil... There really needs to be less. The last burrito I had here might have been the greasiest burrito I have ever had. (And I eat an average of 3 to 5 burritos per week.) I couldn't finish the burrito. The grease was just too much.  It's unfortunate. What has the potential to be a great burrito is completely destroyed by the greasy, slimy, heavy oil slick these cooks throw down in cookin' up my tubular delight. On the bright side, the hot sauce is good and they aren't stingy with it. Also, the prices are reasonable here. Unfortunately, the House only gets two stars. With so many late night burrito options, I don't think I will be going back anytime soon, unless of course I'm in the mood for a fight!

I had to get to the bottom of it...is this a burrito joint that the drunks stumble into at 4am or is the food actually good during daylight hours?  I went in for dinner around 6pm and I didn't have a drop of alcohol in my system so consider this a sober review.   This place is definitely a "down and dirty" Mexican place.  Notice I said "place" and not "restaurant."  It's more like a service counter that happens to have a few tables and chairs around it.  The most expensive item on the menu is $6.75. I cannot remember the last time I got a junior burrito, chips and salsa, and a fountain drink for under $6.  The bean burrito was good, not great.  I wanted to put salt on it.  It looks like they put the burrito in a skillet and toast the outside of it (like a quesadilla) so the tortilla is actually a little crispy.  The chips were slightly greasy, but BIG UPPS to them for serving a large cup of spicy (hot sauce) salsa with the chips!  Restaurants that do this have balls the size of church bells and know their customers like a little heat!  love it.   Sigh--my tummy hurt 2 hours after I ate there.  But don't read into that..I have ongoing stomach issues.  It was a solid 3 stars, but dammit, my quest for the best bean burrito in Chicago continues.  And by the way, shame on you people who think Chipotle is good.  Posers.

How many  variations on Taco, Burrito, House, Place, and Palace are there in Chicago? Come on, get a little more creative with the name... This is just another stock Mexican 5 am place... the food is no different than any of the other 100,000 restaurants like it in Chicago... .I've eaten here a few times when I lived in the neighborhood... and it serves its purpose.... unhealthy food late at night.... nothing else really jumps out. Prices are similar to the rest, food is probably from the same supplier as the rest... anything else I must have missed.
Get the chicken salad or the pork salad, cheap. The chicken there is awesome. This my favorite burrito joint in the chi.
This place gives me chips and guac whenever I crave it. What else do you need to know?

Fresh and as nongreasy as it gets--I actually did not feel gross or bloated after eating a burrito. And it was delicious. What a gem.  They heat their tortillas over the grill so it's all warm and cripsy. Mmmm. The junior size was plenty, I can't imagine how big a king is! What's great about it is that most burrito places use rice as their filler but here at TBH, there's NO rice--just the good stuff. I recommend the pollo and steak. Prices are also ridiculously reasonable.

Ohhhh... dreamy dreamy dreamy.  My boyfriend and I have not missed a weekend of getting TBH for the last 2.5 years.  I love the chicken tacos and the steak burritos.  They are ALWAYS accomodating when you ask for no ingredients (or added!) and they always have our order ready a few minutes after we phone it in.  The only downfall is that I am afraid to go in there sometimes.  There are a lot of fights and it's not safe for a little girl like me.  The restaurant is always clean, the bathroom is always spotless.  This is where I take everyone from out-of-town.  And it's the first place they always ask to go when they come back to Chicago.

I've never been disappointed with this place, as a late-night dining option. Great sizes on the burritos, tacos, etc. you get here, very friendly staff, clean bathroom(props to them for requiring patrons to ask for a key before using the bathroom, and I'm sure why it's so clean), and won't say too much else. I just know if TBH traded places with El Norte at Bryn Mawr/Ridge/Broadway, I'd never be able to stop myself from going here constantly. Will also add that if you hit this place post-bar closing rush, and are in a big group, it may be best to get your food to go, since the dining area is very small. I'll refer you to reading Ron, Benjamin, or Kristin's TBH review for further highlights about here.
For a taquiera, pretty damn clean. The tacos (I got the tongue and the beef) are gigantic. One can be a meal. Good option for the area.

I wish I could give this place 6 stars...you know what, I just did.  6 Stars for Taco Burrito House, or TBH for those in the circle.    So I am going to give the best compliment anyone can give any burrito spot, I WILL EAT HERE SOBER!  That's right, any day any time, you get yourself in there and get the best burrito in the city.  I have been to more burrito joints than I can remember, and that's probably because I have been to most of them after an 8 hour bender!  But this one is the best by far. Start yourself off with a plate of nachos (make sure there is at least two people with you) they are awesome, and then wrap it up with a king size burrito...get it, "wrap it up", oh man is that funny!  They have junior burritos for those who don't eat like they are going to the electric chair.  I like the "fajita" burrito the best, but all are good.  And the prices are outstanding considering the amount of food they throw in front of you. The service is great and the staff is surprisingly friendly for having to deal with annoying drunks all night. My only suggestion is to leave the bar about 15 minutes before closing, as this place fills up fast after the bars close and seating is limited.

My senior year at the U of C my best friend and I came here every night for almost a month straight.  Sometimes we drove all the way up to Fullerton twice a day to indulge in king size al pastor burritos and essentially perfect tacos.  Tacos and burritos come with generous toppings and both the red and the green sauce are top notch.  But the thing that makes this hands down my favorite taqueria in the city is the pico de gallo.  Extra spicy and absolutely packed with cilantro, it is the salsa fresca that I judge all other salsa frescas by--including my own.  And it's open til like 5 am on the weekends.  If you are drinking at the nearby Liar's Club it would be a huge mistake not to hit this place on your way home.

Although the no-frills name may steer away the creative burrito buyer, there are many SOLID reasons why the Taco & Burrito House is an excellent late night option: 1) The people who work here are friendly, quick and informative 2)  The bathroom is CLEAN.  Holy, crap what a crapper! 3) Quite a steal - those burritos are massive! 4) Crushed ice 5) You don't wind up with a nasty case of the F.P. the next day (this is probably the most important plus). Just don't order the Nachos (they're a Nach-NO in my book) and you will have a happy late night experience.  Promise.

The quality of the food compared to the fast preparation is incredibly high. The service is exceptionally nice, even with a room of people going home from the bars. I recommend the steak fajita burrito, its my new all time favorite! You can get a nice meal with the few bucks left over from the bar!

I believe this was the very first shop in the local Taco & Burrito House "chain", and it hasn't changed much since it opened many years ago.  It's a good choice for a filling, fairly cheap, and greasy old-school burrito.  I recommend doing carry-out as the dining area is small & has absolutely no atmosphere - though local cops seem not to mind much, I've often seen them dining here.

I ended up here late last night with a bunch of Taco & Burrito House fans. I tried the Junior chicken burrito (after the warning that the normal sized one is absolutely gigantic) and wasn't overly impressed.  I think I prefer Chipotle!
This is it for cheap Mexican chow!  First rate burritos and tacos.  Sadly after many years they discontinued the bacon burrito.
